greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = r^(p-2) mod p, where p is the n-th prime and r is the least positive primitive root of p.
comment: a(n) is the last element of row n of A254309.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = r^(p-2) mod p, with p = A000040(n) and r = A001918(n).
mathematica: a[n_] := With[{p = Prime[n]}, Mod[PrimitiveRoot[p]^(p-2), p]]; Array[a, 70] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 24 2017 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 04 2015
